mhframework.ai.path

Class MHPathFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • mhframework.ai.path.MHPathFinder

  • public class MHPathFinder
extends java.lang.Object
    Derived from pseudo-code in "The Basics of A* for Path Planning", Bryan Stout In 'Game Programming Gems', Mike DeLoura (ed.) Charles River Media, 2000, part 3.3, pp. 254-263

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static MHNodePath aStarSearch(MHMapCellAddress startLoc, MHMapCellAddress goalLoc, MHTileMap map)
      Searches the given map for a path from the specified start to the specified goal by stepping in any direction.
      static MHNodePath aStarSearch(MHMapCellAddress startLoc, MHMapCellAddress goalLoc, MHTileMap map, MHTileMapDirection[] directions)
      Searches the given map for a path from the specified start to the specified goal by stepping only in the specified directions.

    • Method Detail

      • aStarSearch

        public static MHNodePath aStarSearch(MHMapCellAddress startLoc,
                     MHMapCellAddress goalLoc,
                     MHTileMap map,
                     MHTileMapDirection[] directions)
        Searches the given map for a path from the specified start to the specified goal by stepping only in the specified directions.
        Parameters:
        startLoc - The starting location.
        goalLoc - The goal.
        map - The map to be searched.
        directions - An array of MHTileMapDirection values indicating which directions a unit can step.
        Returns:
        An MHNodePath from the start to the goal, or null if no path found.

      • aStarSearch

        public static MHNodePath aStarSearch(MHMapCellAddress startLoc,
                     MHMapCellAddress goalLoc,
                     MHTileMap map)
        Searches the given map for a path from the specified start to the specified goal by stepping in any direction.
        Parameters:
        startLoc - The starting location.
        goalLoc - The goal.
        map - The map to be searched.
        Returns:
        An MHNodePath from the start to the goal, or null if no path found.
